Introduction to `noreden`

Source: vignettes/noreden.Rmd
noreden.Rmd
library(noreden)
#> Loading required package: ggplot2

This is the first vignette document for how to use the package.

Let us try to load a dataset.

head(all_diet)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 4
#>   food_name    intake_mean intake_lwr intake_upr
#>   <chr>              <dbl>      <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 Bread             188.       18.8        344. 
#> 2 Other grains       48.3       4.83       156. 
#> 3 Cakes              38.2       3.82       142. 
#> 4 Potatoes           72.8       7.28       231. 
#> 5 Vegetables        166.       16.6        420. 
#> 6 Legumes             3.76      0.376       30.7
head(contrib_per_unit)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 10
#>   food_name    energy protein  carbs   sugar  fiber     fat vitaminc calcium
#>   <chr>         <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>

Select food and outcomes of interest

Input data

tag_food_9 <- c('Bread', 'Vegetables', 'Red meat', 
              'Milk, yoghurt', 'Fish', 'Cheese', 
              'Eggs', 'Fruit, berries', 'Potatoes')

tag_outcome_7 <- c('energy', 'protein', 'carbs', 'fat', 
                   'vitaminc',  'calcium', 'ghge')
diet_selected <- select_diet(
  data_diet = all_diet,
  tag_food = tag_food_9)

diet_selected
#> # A tibble: 9 × 4
#>   food_name      intake_mean intake_lwr intake_upr
#>   <chr>                <dbl>      <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 Bread                188.       18.8        344.
#> 2 Potatoes              72.8       7.28       231.
#> 3 Vegetables           166.       16.6        420.
#> 4 Fruit, berries       184.       18.4        553.
#> 5 Red meat             126.       12.6        300.
#> 6 Fish                  74.6       7.46       303.
#> 7 Eggs                  26.4       2.64       112.
#> 8 Milk, yoghurt        329.       32.9        901.
#> 9 Cheese                46.6       4.66       122.
cpu_selected <- select_perunit(
  data_perunit_contrib = contrib_per_unit, 
  tag_food = tag_food_9, 
  tag_outcome = tag_outcome_7)
cpu_selected
#> # A tibble: 9 × 8
#>   food_name      energy protein   carbs     fat vitaminc calcium    ghge
#>   <chr>           <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1 Bread           10.7  0.0912  0.441   0.0302   0.00570  0.336  0.00107
#> 2 Potatoes         3.79 0.0206  0.178   0.00737  0.133    0.0885 0.00037
#> 3 Vegetables       1.57 0.0149  0.0498  0.00841  0.207    0.259  0.00103
#> 4 Fruit, berries   2.73 0.00758 0.134   0.00408  0.198    0.152  0.00072
#> 5 Red meat         8.34 0.173   0.0136  0.139    0.0425   0.111  0.0129 
#> 6 Fish             6.09 0.170   0.0245  0.0748   0        0.245  0.00311
#> 7 Eggs             6.18 0.130   0.00407 0.106    0        0.528  0.00215
#> 8 Milk, yoghurt    1.98 0.0359  0.0559  0.0111   0        1.28   0.00143
#> 9 Cheese          13.5  0.217   0.0484  0.242    0        6.59   0.0103

Compute total contribution

For selected food and outcomes of interest

tc <- compute_total_contrib(
  data_diet = diet_selected, 
  data_perunit_contrib = cpu_selected)

tc
#> $total_contrib
#>   tag_outcome total_contrib
#> 1      energy   6002.791497
#> 2     protein     82.349152
#> 3       carbs    153.317587
#> 4         fat     49.280653
#> 5    vitaminc     86.965858
#> 6     calcium    914.751986
#> 7        ghge      3.404557
#> 
#> $tag_food
#> [1] "Bread"          "Potatoes"       "Vegetables"     "Fruit, berries"
#> [5] "Red meat"       "Fish"           "Eggs"           "Milk, yoghurt" 
#> [9] "Cheese"        
#> 
#> $tag_outcome
#> [1] "energy"   "protein"  "carbs"    "fat"      "vitaminc" "calcium"  "ghge"

Set constraints 

constr_coef_df <- set_constr_coef(
  tag_outcome = tag_outcome_7, 
  coef_lwr = rep(0.9, length(tag_outcome_7)), 
  coef_upr = rep(1.0, length(tag_outcome_7)))
constr_coef_df
#>   tag_outcome coef_constrlwr coef_construpr
#> 1      energy            0.9              1
#> 2     protein            0.9              1
#> 3       carbs            0.9              1
#> 4         fat            0.9              1
#> 5    vitaminc            0.9              1
#> 6     calcium            0.9              1
#> 7        ghge            0.9              1
# reduce ghge to 0.9
constr_coef_df_red <- reduce_constr(
  data_constr_coef = constr_coef_df, 
  tag_outcome_reduce = 'ghge', 
  coef_reduce = 0.9)
constr_coef_df_red
#>   tag_outcome coef_constrlwr coef_construpr
#> 1      energy           0.90            1.0
#> 2     protein           0.90            1.0
#> 3       carbs           0.90            1.0
#> 4         fat           0.90            1.0
#> 5    vitaminc           0.90            1.0
#> 6     calcium           0.90            1.0
#> 7        ghge           0.81            0.9

Use total contribution and constraint coefficients to compute the upper and lower bound

cd_constr_raw_reduce <- compute_constr(
  data_total_contrib = tc$total_contrib, 
  data_constr_coef = constr_coef_df_red)

cd_constr_raw_reduce
#>   tag_outcome total_contrib coef_constrlwr coef_construpr  constr_lwr
#> 1      energy   6002.791497           0.90            1.0 5402.512347
#> 2     protein     82.349152           0.90            1.0   74.114237
#> 3       carbs    153.317587           0.90            1.0  137.985828
#> 4         fat     49.280653           0.90            1.0   44.352588
#> 5    vitaminc     86.965858           0.90            1.0   78.269272
#> 6     calcium    914.751986           0.90            1.0  823.276788
#> 7        ghge      3.404557           0.81            0.9    2.757691
#>    constr_upr
#> 1 6002.791497
#> 2   82.349152
#> 3  153.317587
#> 4   49.280653
#> 5   86.965858
#> 6  914.751986
#> 7    3.064101
